concept.title: Introduction to containerized Nokia Converged Charging

conbody.p: Nokia Converged Charging (NCC) is a real-time rating and charging platform. The containerized version of NCC is built with containerized network functions (CNFs) and is called NCC CNF.
NCC CNF is a cloud-native application that is built around Kubernetes principles. The following are the key features of NCC:

ul.li: NCC uses Docker, containers, Helm charts, and more.
NCC supports dynamic horizontal scaling, and in-service updates.
NCC is a 5G application, and its internal protocols are service-mesh friendly.
NCC is designed as loosely coupled microservices and packaged as lightweight containers.
NCC is agnostic to cloud platforms.
NCC supports the best-in-class industry standard tools such as Jaeger, Prometheus, Kafka, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Kiali, Istio, Grafana software, and more.

conbody.note: The initial NCC CNF version does not yet certify the in-service nature of the updates without traffic interruption. Therefore, it is recommended to switch traffic to the other ME in the pair prior to starting the upgrade. The in-service certification feature is coming soon.

section.title: Deployment environments
section.p: The initial NCC CNF version is targeted for deployment into a customer's Kubernetes environment. However, NCC CNF is generic and flexible by nature and can be deployed in other environments as well.
